channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-5546] Master assigns region in the original region server when opening region failed
item.description:
Master assigns region in the original region server when RS_ZK_REGION_FAILED_OPEN envent was coming.
Maybe we should choose other region server.

[2012-03-07 10:14:21,750] [DEBUG] [main-EventThread] [org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.AssignmentManager 553] Handling transition=RS_ZK_REGION_FAILED_OPEN, server=158-1-130-11,20020,1331108408232, region=c70e98bdca98a0657a56436741523053
[2012-03-07 10:14:31,826] [DEBUG] [main-EventThread] [org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.AssignmentManager 553] Handling transition=RS_ZK_REGION_FAILED_OPEN, server=158-1-130-11,20020,1331108408232, region=c70e98bdca98a0657a56436741523053

item.summary: Master assigns region in the original region server when opening region failed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: +1 on clearing the region plan and updating it.

@Gao
Are you working on this patch?
Submitted patch for 0.96 version. Please review and provide your comments/suggestions

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12526363/hbase-5546.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 3 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop23. The patch compiles against the hadoop 0.23.x profile.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

-1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.TestDrainingServer
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.regionserver.TestServerCustomProtocol
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.master.TestSplitLogManager

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/1830//testReport/
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/1830//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarnings.html
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/1830//console

Patch looks good.

May need to run through QA again for better confidence.

This message is automatically generated.
+1, Good job!

Do you want to use this method instead Ashutosh:

  RegionPlan getRegionPlan(final RegionState state,

      final ServerName serverToExclude, final boolean forceNewPlan)

You can pass in the name of the server you do not want it to go to.

In your patch as is, you could get a plan that sends you back to the same server?

Your tests is excellent. Nice.
Submitted updated patch for 0.96. Please review and provide your suggestion/comments.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12527466/hbase-5546_2.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

I think the getRegionPlan() call makes clearRegionPlan() unnecessary because forceNewPlan parameter is true.

@Ted
Attached patch with changes suggested.With this change if there is only one RS then new plan will not be created.

Patch looks good.
Minor comment:


+          // Here a new region plan is formed with a different destination regionServer and 

+          // updated in the regionPlans. But a new regionPlan is formed only if more than

The above two sentences are not consistent. Please remove '. But a new regionPlan is formed'

@Ted
I can remove that on commit, if it is ok with you?
